links.title: Is the Tesla Roadster Flying on the Falcon Heavy's Maiden Flight Just Space Junk?
links.description: The maiden flight of SpaceX's Falcon Heavy booster, slated to launch tomorrow (Feb. 6), comes factory-equipped with a Tesla Roadster as a part of the payload/ballast, and is meant to be hurled toward a solar orbit that could take it as far out as the orbit of Mars.

messages.body: $SPY Another- "Tech stocks look downright awful in market getting worried about 'unhinged inflation" https://www.cnbc.com/2018/02/05/morgan-stanley-tech-stocks-look-downright-awful.html $INTC $AMD $TSLA

links.title: Morgan Stanley: Tech stocks look 'downright awful' in market getting increasingly worried about 'unhinged' inflation
links.description: Many strategists have hypothesized that the sell-off is the result of several months of uninterrupted gains for equity markets, a correction to overpriced stocks and inflated assets. And with the yield on the 10-year Treasury note climbing roughly 40 basis points since the start of the year, investors may be in for a bumpy ride.

messages.body: $SPY "Tech sector downgraded as earnings revisions trend looks 'downright awful Morgan Stanley" https://www.marketwatch.com/story/technology-sector-downgraded-as-earnings-revisions-trend-looks-downright-awful--morgan-stanley-2018-02-05 $INTC $AMD $QQQ $TSLA

links.title: Technology sector downgraded as earnings revisions trend looks 'downright awful'--Morgan Stanley
links.description: By Investors should take profits on technology sector stocks, suggested Morgan Stanley's U.S. equity strategy team, as the sector was downgraded to equal weight from overweight on weakening earnings revisions. Equity strategist Michael Wilson said when there is doubt about the direction of the broader stock market, he always looks to "relative earnings revision breadth," or which sectors have the highest percentages of upward or downward earnings revisions.

links.title: Are We in a Bear Market Now?
links.description: A bear market is when the price of an investment falls over time. It occurs when prices drop 20 percent or more from their 52-week high. A bear market can start with a stock market crash when prices plummet 10 percent in a day or two.
